data.note: There are several generation, transmission and distribution companies in Peru. Generation, transmission and distribution are both legally and practically separated. In the early 1990s, the Peruvian power sector was unbundled, opened to private sector investment, and regulatory models were established for each segment.
data.name: The power sector has been unbundled (whether privatized or not) into distinct actors for generation, transmission, distribution and retail

data.note: There are several generation, transmission and distribution companies in Peru. Generation, transmission and distribution are both legally and practically separated. In the early 1990s, the Peruvian power sector was unbundled, opened to private sector investment, and regulatory models were established for each segment.
data.name: There are legally separate private companies at each segment of the power system pre-retail

data.note: The  Comite de Operacion Economica del Sistema (COES) is the transmission system operator in Peru.
data.name: There is an independent transmission system that dispatches according to market dynamics and is not susceptible to state interference

data.note: The 'Fondo de Compensación Social Eléctrica' (FOSE) is an electricity subsidy mechanism created in 2001 under the law 27510. Consumers with monthly consumption under 100kWh can obtain discounts on their electricity bills.
data.name: Retail electricity prices aren't distorted by subsidies

data.note: The  Ley de Concesiones Eléctricas Nº 25844 allows private participation in the generation sector. There is 48 generation companies.
data.name: There aren't significant barriers to private sector participation in generation

data.note: In 2013, some 56.4% of the power purchased was through the regulated market, and 43.6% through the free market. The latter consists of large end-users and generators contracting bilaterally.
data.name: Consumers can choose retail suppliers or third-party power marketers in the retail power market

data.note: Article 1 of Law 28832 allows medium-size and large customers to buy electricity in the wholesale market. But there is a lack of regulation so the market does not operate. Spot prices are effective for transactions between generators. Customers (consumidores libres) with installed capacity of more than 10MW can enter the spot market, but effectively no free customer buys energy there.
data.name: There is a functioning competitive wholesale generation market

data.note: Edegel (private), Enersur (private), Electroperu (state-owned) and Kallpa (private) own 60% of installed capacity in Peru,PE, the remaining 40% is owned by 44 other companies. (2015)
data.name: The generation market has many different actors and is not concentrated in the hands of a few players

data.note: There are more than 20 distribution utilities.
data.name: The supply market has many different actors and is not concentrated in the hands of a few players
